title: Ticket #1515: Add open files to ProcAPI::getProcInfo & condor_procd
description: ProcAPI::getProcInfo should return the list of open regular files associated with the process. This information then has to be transmitted to the condor_procd and across the pipe to any clients asking for it. This new information must also exist in the proc_family.cpp codes and be aggregated properly when talking about families of processes.
remarks:
2010-Jul-21 15:09:24 by psilord:
Ok, I've run into a bit of a problem.

The procd's ProcFamilyClient and ProcFamilyServer classes communicate a ProcFamilyUsage structure over a pipe. Unfortunately, the communication system consists of read(&mystruct, len) and write(&mystruct, len). :(

This was "fine" when there were only integral quantities in the structure, but when I added a std::set<std::string> open_files; member variable to the ProcFamilyUsage structure...well, that doesn't serialize across processes as nicely...

So, I need to think a little bit about how to deal with this.

2010-Jul-21 15:37:11 by psilord:
After some thought, I'm going to change the protocol for ProcFamilyClient::get_usage() and ProcFamilyServer::get_usage() to serialize the ProcFamilyUsage structure element by element.

I'll carefully serialize the std::set<std::string> open_files; field in the same manner as the std::vector<ProcFamilyProcessDump> procs; field in the ProcFamilyDump structure--generally following the whole serialization process of the ProcFamilyDump structure.

2010-Jul-23 16:11:26 by psilord:
I've changed the protocol, and it seems to be working.

2010-Jul-23 16:48:17 by psilord:
This ticket is left open until I can finish the c++ util implementation of takesnapshot, which is a duplicate code path to how we use the procd. This is because the master directly uses the procapi, but all other daemons use the procd.

2010-Jul-26 16:19:08 by psilord:
Ok, I hacked in the other library's support needed for this feature. Will commit soon.

2010-Jul-27 11:47:13 by psilord:
Ok, it is committed, so this ticket can be resolved.
